content: I apologize for misunderstanding. In your world, determining the appropriate level of resource allocation to provide basic needs and encourage work may require careful consideration and experimentation. One approach could be to start with a baseline level of resources that are sufficient to meet basic needs, such as food, shelter, and healthcare, and then gradually increase the level of resources provided as individuals demonstrate their willingness and ability to work. This could involve providing incentives or rewards for those who contribute to the economy or community through their labor, such as access to additional resources or privileges. It may also involve setting up a system for tracking resource use and allocation, as mentioned earlier, to help ensure that resources are distributed fairly and efficiently.
